column4: I need some help with fsck options. I dont know which ones I need to use. I've tried different combos and nothing is happening. http://linux.die.net/man/8/fsck
you're running it with sudo right
im logged in as root
fsck -l did not return anything
you can use e2fsck -c to check for bad blocks on the device
i tried that command, but it seems to be missing another option
thanks
e2fsck: Device or resource busy while trying to open /dev/sda1 Filesystem mounted or opened exclusively by another program?
make sure the device is unmounted
what're you trying to scan, your current root partition?
no, im not using that partition. im on a network boot
so it cant be mounted, right?
run "mount"
http://pastie.org/4034385
ok
same thing :\
try just running e2fsck -f /dev/sda1
e2fsck: Device or resource busy while trying to open /dev/sda1 Filesystem mounted or opened exclusively by another program?
try running umount /dev/sda1
umount: /dev/sda1: not mounted
max filename size is 255 bytes for ext4
thank you, thats the problem, i think. gonna try it out and see if that fixes it
